001package squidpony;
002
003import squidpony.panel.IColoredString;
004
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.Collection;
007import java.util.Iterator;
008
009/**
010 * An helper class for code that deals with lists of {@link IColoredString}s. It
011 * does nothing smart, its only purpose is to save you some typing for frequent
012 * calls. 
013 * <br>
014 * This class is deprecated in favor of using standard JDK {@code ArrayList<IColoredString<T>>}, where T is usually
015 * Color from libGDX. Using ArrayList lets you build these using {@link Maker#makeList(Object[])}, if you want. Some of
016 * the methods in this class aren't very obvious for what they actually do; {@link #add(Object)} will add a new line,
017 * while {@link #addText(String)} will append text to the last line.
018 * 
019 * @author smelC
020 * @deprecated This class duplicates the functionality of an ArrayList of IColoredString, and isn't very clear.
021 */
022@Deprecated
023public class ColoredStringList<T> extends ArrayList<IColoredString<T>> {
024
025        private static final long serialVersionUID = -5111205714079762803L;
026
027        public ColoredStringList() {
028                super();
029        }
030
031        public ColoredStringList(int expectedSize) {
032                super(expectedSize);
033        }
034
035        /**
036         * @return A fresh empty instance.
037         */
038        public static <T> ColoredStringList<T> create() {
039                return new ColoredStringList<T>();
040        }
041
042        /**
043         * @param expectedSize
044         * @return A fresh empty instance.
045         */
046        public static <T> ColoredStringList<T> create(int expectedSize) {
047                return new ColoredStringList<T>(expectedSize);
048        }
049
050        /**
051         * Appends {@code text} to {@code this}, without specifying its color.
052         * 
053         * @param text the text to append
054         */
055        public void addText(String text) {
056                addColoredText(text, null);
057        }
058
059        /**
060         * Appends {@code text} to {@code this}.
061         * 
062         * @param text the text to append
063         */
064        public void addText(IColoredString<T> text) {
065                final int sz = size();
066                if (sz == 0)
067                        add(text);
068                else {
069                        get(sz - 1).append(text);
070                }
071        }
072
073        /**
074         * Appends colored text to {@code this}.
075         * 
076         * @param text the text to append
077         */
078        public void addColoredText(String text, T c) {
079                if (isEmpty())
080                        addColoredTextOnNewLine(text, c);
081                else {
082                        final IColoredString<T> last = get(size() - 1);
083                        last.append(text, c);
084                }
085        }
086
087        /**
088         * Appends text to {@code this}, on a new line; without specifying its
089         * color.
090         * 
091         * @param text the text to append
092         */
093        public void addTextOnNewLine(String text) {
094                addColoredTextOnNewLine(text, null);
095        }
096
097        public void addTextOnNewLine(IColoredString<T> text) {
098                add(text);
099        }
100
101        /**
102         * Appends colored text to {@code this}.
103         * 
104         * @param text the text to append
105         */
106        public void addColoredTextOnNewLine(String text, /* @Nullable */ T color) {
107                this.add(IColoredString.Impl.create(text, color));
108        }
109
110        /**
111         * Adds {@code texts} to {@code this}, starting a new line for the first
112         * one.
113         * 
114         * @param texts the Collection of objects extending IColoredString to append
115         */
116        public void addOnNewLine(Collection<? extends IColoredString<T>> texts) {
117                final Iterator<? extends IColoredString<T>> it = texts.iterator();
118                boolean first = true;
119                while (it.hasNext()) {
120                        if (first) {
121                                addTextOnNewLine(it.next());
122                                first = false;
123                        } else
124                                addText(it.next());
125                }
126        }
127
128        /**
129         * Contrary to {@link Collection#addAll(Collection)}, this method appends
130         * text to the current text, without inserting new lines.
131         *
132         * @param texts the Collection of objects extending IColoredString to append
133         */
134        public void addAllText(Collection<? extends IColoredString<T>> texts) {
135                for (IColoredString<T> text : texts)
136                        addText(text);
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Jumps a line.
141         */
142        public void addEmptyLine() {
143                addTextOnNewLine("");
144                addTextOnNewLine("");
145        }
146
147        /**
148         * Changes a color in members of {@code this}.
149         * 
150         * @param old The color to replace. Can be {@code null}.
151         */
152        public void replaceColor(T old, T new_) {
153                final int sz = size();
154                for (int i = 0; i < sz; i++)
155                        get(i).replaceColor(old, new_);
156        }
157
158}
